channel.title: editor on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist
channel.description: Recent content in editor on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist

item.title: difficulty setting and play time integration
item.description: reintroduced the coding for difficulty setting and programmed a play time clock, so that I can finally see how long the gameplay itself is added the ticker to the menu and save file displays, although doing so required rebuilding a bit of the player’s prefab and animator graph.

item.title: depressive boon?
item.description: was feeling the typical Sunday Sadness, so I fired up the PC to try and catch up on some of the work from last week I was planning on redoing this week.

item.title: wasted week
item.description: something I did broke the save system, not really sure what exactly, so I’ve backed everything up as it was broken and am restoring last week’s backup, which seems to work.

item.title: slowly regaining momentum
item.description: it is beginning to happen though added a data privacy button for opting out and lighting effects for the desert world

item.title: feeling lousy
item.description: two or three days of depression, so I’m working on a holiday. at least it is my least favorite one, maybe second to new year’s, i suppose didn’t really do much.

item.title: swapped scripting backend
item.description: what a rough day i remember it being tricky to go back and forth between scripting backend types (mono, IL2CPP) and needing the internet to do so, but I don’t recall having so many problems!

item.title: mildly winning
item.description: so, i didn’t do anything today, but the rest of the week has been most productive! i’m talking big bugs with single lines; it feels like the home stretch, but honestly it looks halfway there.

item.title: make it make more sense
item.description: you’d think this sort if thing would be more obvious from a design standpoint, but it’s the kind of thing you need to learn first hand or have previous experience, i guess anyway, after questioning the entire health orb mechanic now that healing inventory items work, i came to the conclusion the drop conditions should just be adjusted.
